intro: Senecio boyacensis, commonly known as the Boyacá groundsel, is a flowering plant native to the Andean region of Colombia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble small daisies. The plant typically grows in high-altitude grasslands and shrublands, thriving in cool and temperate climates. Its leaves are usually narrow and hairy, adapted to reduce water loss in its arid environment. Senecio boyacensis is valued for its ornamental appeal and has been studied for its potential medicinal properties.
